meanings.definition: The condition or property of occurring in two distinct forms.
meanings.sent1: The dimorphism of the butterfly species was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: Sexual dimorphism is common in many animal species.
meanings.sent3: The dimorphism of the flowers made them look like they were wearing different outfits.
meanings.sent4: The dimorphism of the clouds created a striking contrast in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful visuals to explain the concept of dimorphism to the students.

meanings.definition: The occurrence of two distinct forms in the same species.
meanings.sent1: The researchers studied the dimorphism in the bird population.
meanings.sent2: In some fish species, color dimorphism helps in camouflage.
meanings.sent3: The dimorphism in the fruit trees made them look like they were playing a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The dimorphism in opinions within the group led to interesting discussions.
meanings.sent5: The artist used light and shadow to depict the dimorphism of the sculpture.
